content:
Posted: May 22, 2015
Batman: Arkham City Pros & Cons ReviewPros1: Masterly written storyline, characters, and encounters weave together an addicting game that foreshadows things to come for the Dark Knight.2: New Gameplay Mechanics, Gadgets, and Upgrades ratchets the bar higher in every way possible from its predecessor.3: Riddler Challenge Rooms brings something new to the table; collecting trophies and solving environmental riddles are present but it’s the Challenge Rooms that steal the show.Cons1: Catwoman’s chapters are too short and simple; it would have been nice to flush out her experiences in Arkham City during the course of the overall story.2: More story expanding DLC would have been nice; especially after getting a savory taste of Robin in Harley Quinn’s Revenge DLC.3: Alternate character skins are nice and nostalgic but the feeling doesn’t last long; special suit effects would have made this content more enjoyable.Downloadable Content ReviewHarley Quinn's RevengePro: Harley Quinn's Revenge is a testament to what DLC should strive to achieve in terms of story.Con: Unfortunately, this DLC comes to its conclusion rather quickly and leaves you wishing for more.Overall: 10/10My Thoughts on Batman: Arkham City,Arkham City takes everything Asylum got right and turned it up to 11! More Riddles, Bosses, and Encounters make for one amazing game with tones more to enjoy. Exploring Arkham City in search of trophies isn’t just to help boost your XP it also unlocks access to Challenge Rooms where you must use your wits to solve physical challenges in hopes of saving hostages. Fighting Bosses isn’t new to the Arkhamvers but the real millstone is the encounter with Mr. Freeze; each takedown performed can’t be repeated, forcing you to use gadgets, environment, and techniques you may not have otherwise considered. Adding to these memorable boss fights are randomly generated encounters with Political Prisoners as well as scripted encounters with new threats whose presence unlocks new Side Quests.The negative points while few and far in-between do still need to be addressed. For one, while boss fights are fun and exciting they can feel underwhelming and at times shoehorned into a game. The latter isn’t true of Arkham City but the former is… Bosses like Catwomen’s fight with Two-Face is anticlimactic to her story arc. Same is true of Robins showdown with Harley Quinn near the end of her DLC; only difference is Quinn has hostages that could be held at gunpoint by some random thug during the course of the fight.Overall Batman: Arkham City is a sequel that doesn’t just deliver the enjoyment from Arkham Asylum it perfects it and it’s guaranteed to see you returning to the streets of Gotham and striking fear into the hearts of Joker, Penguin, Two-Face, and any thug unlucky enough to cross paths with the Dark Knight.-SPARTAN 117 B01

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												A fun brawler.Taking the role of Batman (and Catwoman), you get to explore an open city and beat up thugs in a rhythmic battle system, using a variety of tools. The story is, initially, much more dire than is predecessor, which is further complimented by the cast Batman must face. The addition of collectables and riddles further add to the experience.However, even with the many weapons you are given, it doesn't mix things up too much, and combat can get stale (save for a certain boss and Challenge Mode). The city environment, once you are used to it, ends up being an eyesore. The plot does take an abrupt turn at a certain point, and the additional DLC, while nice (and free), add little to what's already offered.If you enjoy beat-em-ups, or Batman, you'll find Arkham City to be an enjoyable romp. Worth the price, and a definite buy when on sale.

I really enjoyed getting catwoman as a playable character in this one and you actually have to her to get through some specific parts of the game. Just another well-made game by RockSteady to pick up (on sale of course) if you haven't already done so.

content:
Posted: February 5
BackstoryBatman is incarcerated in Arkham City, he must uncover the secret behind the sinister scheme, "Protocol 10", orchestrated by the facility's warden, Hugo Strange.InformationAt the time that you may be reading this you may think to yourself "Isn't this a really old game" or "i swear i heard of the game ages ago" well you are infact right that this games is getting on abit now in terms of it's age and you may be right if you have played this game before, on whatever that platform you played it on may be.Well i'm here to tell you that you should definatly check this game out or revisit it 100%. This game is so much fun not only if you are into games based on the comic books, movies, TV shows etc. or if you are a fan of open world games with a variety of quests to do and a lot of collectibles to be collecting THIS GAME IS FOR YOU!!!Pick this game up and you won't be able to put the controller down or take your hands off of the keyboard and mouse. Trust me, you won't regret it.Pros:- Fighting mechanics are great, super cool and really entertaining - Voice actors for characters such as Batman, Catwomen and Joker are amazing- The storyline is really easy to follow, interesting and emersive- The gadgets and weapons are EPIC- The DLC's that are available with the GOTY Edition are awesome- To run this game you do not need a s high-spec system meaning its good for budget gamers- Did I also mention that the Joker is voiced by Mark Hamill (Luke Skywalker)Cons:- Dialogue from characters like the goons/henchmen is often repeated due to lack of lines- There are only a few voice actors for the goons/henchmen making the lines and voices stale Want my opinion in numbers? - 8/10I hope this review helped you, Game on & Stay Awesome

content:
Posted: September 14, 2014
												Arkham City is exactly what you want in a sequel - bigger and better. Although the size of the city can be daunting at times, the games' seamless offering is worth far more than the price. Rocksteady took their formula for Arkham Asylum and ramped everything up to 11 in delivering this game. More impressive, though, is the fact that while there's is more of everything, everything has its place. There are more characters, but the characters fit nicely into the world and the story and aren't shoehorned in. The city is big, but everything detailed and put to use. The Riddler puzzles are accompanied by many other side missions, most of which are well thought-out and applied in such a way that isn't superfluous. My only gripe is that the DLC was kind of pointless and offered little on top of the base game. But that's really by the by when the base game is so large and you don't have to purchase the DLC. Therefore I have no grips. Arkham City is one of the most polished and entertaining offerings you can hope to buy at this point in time.

												Definitely one of the best gaming experiences of its time.This is the first game that made me go "woah" the first time I played it. The combat, the gliding, the characters, everything was so well put together. I never thought games could be this well narrated, especially an adaptation of a series from another medium. You really get the atmosphere you see in the comic books, the dark overtone, the creepiness of characters. The game makes use of the Teen rating given to it very well, as an M rated version of the game wouldn't make sense lore wise (specifically the series this game adapts), and respects the nature of batman very well. Play this game, you will not be disappointed in the slightest.

content:
Posted: October 27, 2013
												This is a game in which you really feel like Batman. Just gliding around a walled prison city waiting to break some limbs. The damage Batman does, you pretty much kill them. Fine with me. The story is really good, and you really feel like you get to know Batman. For gameplay, you might be beating up a gang of well, gangsters, and making them wish they were never born one minute. The next, you're in a museum or church, sneaking around armed thugs, taking them out silently, one by one. Many iconic Batman characters appear, like Commisioner Gordon, Joker, and Two-Face, with a cast of lesser-known characters, like Jack Ryder, Azrael, and Ra's al Ghul. Small spoiler, but in the last boss battle against Clayface, Batman uses a SWORD. The DLCs provide tons of replayability, with challenge maps, skins, and even story content. Playable characters are expanded to include Catwoman, Robin, and Nightwing. This stealth/combat/open world game is definetly worth buying.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 19, 2016
												Returned to Arkham Asylum and Arkham City after so many years.  Combat was as fun as I remember, although the boss fights get tedious (particularly in AA, AC improved a bit).  The open world of AC means more gameplay, but the storyline itself wanders a bit.  Gliding over the city is a blast, at least for Batman.  Catwoman is fun to fight with (if limited), but god, her movement mechanism is annoying.  Harley Quinn's DLC is fun, and Robin fights like the acrobat he is.  Too bad he sees limited play even in his own DLC.  And it's a crime that you can't use him in the open world like Catwoman.That said--  my computer is better these days than when I played the original games.  But I still get cutscene crashes and lock ups when there's too many particle effects:  not a problem I remember having before.   I CNTRL-ALT-DELETE and restart my way through because I love these games so much, but my performance issues with these rereleased games were enough to keep me from buying Arkham Knight (which reportedly is even worse in that regard).Shaky thumbs up.  If you've got a state of the art rig (mine really isn't these days, but like I said, better than my old), I doubt you'll have a problem.  If you don't and you've got a console, I'd recommend playing on that instead of the PC port.

content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												In this action-packed, superhero game, you play as THE MAN OF STEEL as he attempts to take on his most dangerous foes in the city of METROPOLIS.  Now you may be wondering how I know that you play as Superman rather than Batman, seeing as how his name is in the title.  Well, just take a look at the gameplay:  The Batman in this can SEE THROUGH WALLS, he can FLY, and he can take SEVERAL BULLETS TO THE CHEST.  These are all powers that SUPERMAN has, not Batman.  Therefore, this is the greatest Superman game of all time.

												Personally my favourite of the Arkham series. A fun to traverse open world and a tight combat system. You should hear a swarm of bats and be able to select costumes when selecting continue. you have to do this each time you load up the game.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												Batman Arkham Asylum and Batman Arkham City games turned out to be an event not to be missed, they seem too have changed our ideas how cool computer games can be. Still millions of fans look forward to getting more Arkham games. The good news is we are going to get a new (prequel) game about the Dark Knight at the end of this year. I mean Batman Arkham Origins and this game is already on the way. I hope Rocksteady is working on Batman Arkham 4, and there are some proofs to this hope: read more at http://www.viewforum.net/gaming-dept-171/batman-arkham-game-3-4-prequel-sequel-3387/

content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												Brilliant. For a game thats based of a superhero and films, its extremely impressive. I am a person that gets bored very quickly and I find myself skipping all the cutscenes in a game so that I can get into the actual playing quicker, however in this game I was so immersed in the story and the characters so much that i would sit through all the cutscenes. The combat is great, its so much fun and you just feel so awesome how your characters kick so much♥♥♥♥♥;) A MUST buy!

Punch exciting things such as:- Criminals!- SUPER Criminals!- Ninjas!- Robots!- A Shark!At one point in the game, BatMan ditches his trusty hand-fists in favor of a sword, and the game ends shortly thereafter as the developers realized their mistake.NOTE: DLC includes two characters who use weapons instead of fists. Ignore content accordingly.

content:
Posted: October 15, 2015
												Best Arkham game in my opinion. The story is super enjoyable for those who know a lot of Batman/DC lore but still easy to follow for a comic newbie. Best thirdperson combat system out there, nothing else is so smooth, brutal, or badass. GOTY edition includes extra challenge maps for when you want more of the combat after the story is done. One of my favorite games of all time.
